member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackConfiguration
member.summary: Defines the configuration options for the Slack binding.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackConfiguration.WebHookUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets a global default Slack WebHookURL. If not explicitly set, the value will be defaulted to the value specified via the 'AzureWebJobsSlackWebHookKeyName' app setting or the 'AzureWebJobsSlackWebHookKeyName' environment variable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackConfiguration.Username
member.summary: Gets or sets the default "from: username" that will be used for messages. This value can be overridden by job functions.
member.remarks: This is a useful setting if you're planning on having lots of WebJobs posting to the same WebHook, and want to differeniate them with separate usernames.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackConfiguration.IconEmoji
member.summary: Gets or sets the default "Icon Emoji" that will be used for messages. This value can be overridden by job functions.
member.remarks:
This is a useful setting if you're planning on having lots of WebJobs posting to the same WebHook, and want to differeniate them with separate Icons.
The format for emoji is a keyword surrounded by ":". It supports custom emojis.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackConfiguration.Channel
member.summary: Gets or sets the default "to: channel" that will be used for messages. This value can be overridden by job functions.
member.remarks:
To send to a specific channel, use the "#channel" pattern.
To send to a specific user, use the "@username" pattern.
This is a useful setting if you're reusing the same WebHook as another integration, but want to use a separate channel. It is also helpful for testing purposes.
member.example: Example for sending to a specific channel, bot-channel: "#bot-channel" Example for sending to a specific user: "@username"

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackConfiguration.IsMarkdown
member.summary: Gets or sets the default on whether Markdown be used for formatting messages. This value can be overridden by job functions.
member.remarks: This is a useful setting if you're planning on having lots of WebJobs posting to the same WebHook, and want to differeniate them with separate usernames.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackJobHostConfigurationExtensions.UseSlack(Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.JobHostConfiguration,Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackConfiguration)
member.summary: Enables use of the Slack extensions

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to binds a parameter to a SendGridMessage that will automatically be sent when the function completes.
member.remarks: The method parameter can be of type or a reference to one ('ref' parameter). When using a reference parameter, you can indicate that the message should not be sent by setting it to before your job function returns.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackAttribute.WebHookUrl
member.summary: Sets the WebHookUrl for the current outgoing Slack message
member.remarks: You can use parameters ("{fromTriggerProperty}") or a name resolver ("%fromINameResolver%") to format your setting's string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackAttribute.Text
member.summary: Sets the Text for the current outgoing Slack message
member.remarks: You can use parameters ("{fromTriggerProperty}") or a name resolver ("%fromINameResolver%") to format your setting's string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackAttribute.Username
member.summary: Sets the username for the outgoing request.
member.remarks: You can use parameters ("{fromTriggerProperty}") or a name resolver ("%fromINameResolver%") to format your setting's string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackAttribute.IconEmoji
member.summary: Controls the icon emoji displayed for the message. Use ":{emoji_name}:" in your string.
member.remarks: You can use parameters ("{fromTriggerProperty}") or a name resolver ("%fromINameResolver%") to format your setting's string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackAttribute.Channel
member.summary: Controls the channel the message is sent to. Use "#{name}" to send to a channel, and "@{name}" to send to a specific user."
member.remarks: You can use parameters ("{fromTriggerProperty}") or a name resolver ("%fromINameResolver%") to format your setting's string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SlackAttribute.IsMarkdown
member.summary: Tells Slack whether to process this message as Markdown or not
